body: cc @dongcarl @fanquake @theuni
For the scripted-diff please use `git ls-files ...` or similar. Otherwise it will change out-of-tree files as well.

Updated fdaeb5207bc58a7c93472d1bac82b2c373d6f1be -> b48fd7bf3f3276f5e21cd7de960a859754b20285 ([pr22552.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22552.01) -> [pr22552.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22552.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr22552.01..pr22552.02)):

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#23495](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23495) (build: Bump Fontconfig version up to 2.12.6 by hebasto)
* [#23340](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23340) (build: upgrade to boost 1.77 to fix c++20 compilation by PastaPastaPasta)
* [#22708](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22708) (build, qt: Add Wayland support for Linux builds with depends by hebasto)
* [#22380](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22380) (build: add and use C_STANDARD and CXX_STANDARD in depends by fanquake)
* [#21778](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778) (POC: LLVM 13 & LLD based macOS toolchain by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> Why might this be happening? This PR hits the nail on the head by attacking the use of recursive variables.

Thanks @jarolrod for your detailed explanation, it wasn't kind of clear to me in the OP what was exactly fragile here, and how it is fixed. I don't know a lot about makefile internals, but avoiding inadvertent issues that could result in wrong builds seems important. Concept ACK.

Would be good if @theuni has a look over the changes I think.
